intro: Gymnanthes multiramea var. genuina, commonly known as the Mexican buttercup, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that resemble those of the buttercup. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in shaded or semi-shaded environments. It has alternate, simple leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds.
